intro: Nothopanax colensoi, commonly known as the Colenso's syllepis, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in forested areas, thriving in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and berries that mature to a dark red color. Nothopanax colensoi is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and evolutionary significance.
